intro: Languas melanocarpa, commonly known as the black-fruited bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Languas melanocarpa thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. It is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
